Class Cell

java.lang.Object
com.example.demo.ui.Cell
public class Cell extends Object
Represents a single tile or "cell" on the 2048 game grid.

This class manages both the visual and logical representation of a tile: - Displaying and updating number values - Handling merges and swaps with other cells - Dynamically adjusting color based on value

  • Constructor Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • Cell

      public Cell(double x, double y, double size, javafx.scene.Group root)
      Constructs a new Cell at a given position and size on the game board.
      Parameters:
      x - the X coordinate of the cell
      y - the Y coordinate of the cell
      size - the width/height of the square tile
      root - the JavaFX Group to attach visual elements

  • Method Details

    • setModified

      public void setModified(boolean modified)
      Marks the cell as modified during a move (used to prevent double merges).
      Parameters:
      modified - true if the cell has already merged

    • isModified

      public boolean isModified()
      Returns whether this cell was modified during a move.
      Returns:
      true if modified, false otherwise

    • setTextNode

      public void setTextNode(javafx.scene.text.Text newText)
      Replaces the current text node (used for reassigning during generation).
      Parameters:
      newText - the new text node to attach

    • getNumber

      public int getNumber()
      Returns the numerical value currently displayed in this cell.
      Returns:
      the number as an integer

    • getX

      public double getX()
      Gets the X coordinate of this cell.
      Returns:
      X position

    • getY

      public double getY()
      Gets the Y coordinate of this cell.
      Returns:
      Y position

    • updateVisuals

      public void updateVisuals()
      Updates the cell visuals — background color and text visibility.

    • swapContent

      public void swapContent(Cell target)
      Swaps the content (value and visuals) between this cell and another.
      Parameters:
      target - the other cell to swap with

    • mergeInto

      public int mergeInto(Cell target)
      Merges this cell into the target cell and returns the resulting value. This cell becomes 0 after merging.
      Parameters:
      target - the cell to merge into
      Returns:
      the new merged value

    • applyNewValue

      public void applyNewValue(int value)
      Sets the cell's number and updates its visuals accordingly.
      Parameters:
      value - the number to assign

    • attachTextToRoot

      public void attachTextToRoot()
      Adds this cell's text node to the root group.
